intro: Cyperus elliottianus, commonly known as spikegrass, is a perennial grass native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear at the tips of the stalks. The plant thrives in moist to wet soil conditions, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread rapidly, forming dense stands that can dominate wetland ecosystems. Cyperus elliottianus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
